alert.note: Alert for Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 10:05AM CDT until May 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following bayou in Louisiana...Arkansas... Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill affecting Webster Parish and Columbia County. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill, Louisiana. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, expect minor lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum bayou stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Friday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...Upper Bayou Dorcheat is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 9.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
